page.title: 17ON AN ARUN MEANDER - BURPHAM
page.content: Burpham, a saxon burg, lies at the end of a three mile cul-de-sac with panoramic views. The church still has its own vicar. Across from the church lies a pub, with parking facilities, a recreation groung complete with village hall. Nearby is the old forge, the farrier sells ornamental ironwork on Mondays and Tuesdays, whilst Wednesday, Thursday and Friday sees him out shoeing horses. The environment is mainly affluent, with attractive houses and gardens. Burpham is on a spur resulting in a high- banked drop, dense with vegetation, down to the river Arun below, with its wet-lands and marsh. Westwards, cattle graze the grasslands, crossed by a railway line. The woodlands are deciduous. Amenities; main drains, water, electricity, bus Fridays and school bus. Burpham is lively.
